p: Of course, plants traditionally used as anthelmintics by local healers do not necessarily show anthelmintic activity in C. elegans. Although activity in C. elegans does not correlate perfectly with activity against parasitic nematodes, it remains a useful preliminary test. Some plant extracts that do not exhibit direct anthelmintic activity may act as an irritant of the gastrointestinal tract and expel worms from the intestines that way.
